title: Album Page, "Sketches from Verona", October 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Paper-maker's mark: embossed in support at upper left corner of sheet: an oval with "J M P" in center, ornament above and a small banner that reads "BRISTOL" below.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, clockwise from top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 65 / 76; Door St Anastasia / Verona; Wood Door St Anstasia; Verona / Oct 8th 1887; Iron Railing on Tombs of Scaligers; Bronze Faucet / Certoza of Pavia / Oct 2nd 1887.
description: Vertical sheet with four sketches of architectural elements.  At top left is a faucet in the shape of a winged bird.  At right is the section of a door from the church of St. Anastasia.  The door is composed of rows of small tri-lobed arches, possibly painted white, and decorated by nailheads.  Below this at right is another wood door from St. Anastasia also with a creamy-white finish.  This door is ornamented by rows of carved quatrefoils with a border of half-rosettes and a diamond pattern.  Dark gray nailheads stand out in contrast.  At lower left is a section of an iron railing consisting of joined quatrefoils.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Sketches from Verona", October 1887.
October 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-142.
